question: What happens if I am absent for the End Term (ET) alone with all other assessments completed?
answer: If you are absent for ET alone with all other assessment components completed (quizzes, OPPEs, project, weekly assignments), the grade will be pushed as I (Incomplete).

question: What are my options if I receive an 'I' grade due to ET absence?
answer: You can register to take up the ET exam alone in the subsequent term. OPPE and quizzes will not be scheduled for you. All other marks for the Final course score will be taken from the previous run. You can also choose to repeat the entire course.

question: What happens if I have failed in the OPPE but wrote the ET exam and crossed the cutoff for T?
answer: If you have failed in the OPPE but wrote the ET exam and crossed the cutoff for T as given in the course grading policy, the grade will be I_OP (Incomplete - OPPE).

question: What are my options if I receive an 'I_OP' grade?
answer: You can register to do the OPPE alone whereby if the course has one OPPE, that will be scheduled. If the course has 2 OPPEs, both will be scheduled for you. You can attempt the OPPE alone. All other mark components of the Final course score will be taken from the previous run. ET and quizzes will not be scheduled for you. You can also choose to repeat the entire course.

topic: Incomplete Grade for OPPE Failure and ET Absence
question: What happens if I have failed in the OPPE and am absent for ET?
answer: If you have failed in the OPPE and are absent for ET, then the grade will be I_BOTH (Incomplete - Both OPPE and ET).

topic: Options for Incomplete Grade (OPPE Failure and ET Absence)
question: What are my options if I receive an 'I_BOTH' grade?
answer: You can register to ET and OPPEs alone. If the course has one OPPE, that will be scheduled. If the course has 2 OPPEs, both will be scheduled for you. You will attempt the ET and OPPEs. Quiz and GAA and other components will be taken from the previous run and not scheduled. You can also choose to repeat the entire course.

question: Can I choose to repeat the entire course even if I am eligible to retake only ET or OPPE?
answer: Yes, in all cases of Incomplete grades (I, I_OP, I_BOTH), you can also choose to Repeat the entire course and not just do the ET/OPPE alone if you want to reattempt all assessment components.

topic: Mathematics for data science 1 - Final Score Calculation
question: How is the final course score T calculated for Mathematics for data science 1?
answer: The final course score T for eligible students in Mathematics for data science 1 is calculated as: T = 0.1GAA + max (0.6F + 0.2max(Qz1, Qz2), 0.4F + 0.2Qz1 + 0.3Qz2), where GAA is the average score in the First 10 weekly graded assignments, Qz1 is the score in Quiz I (0 if not attempted), Qz2 is the score in Quiz II (0 if not attempted), and F is the score in the final exam.

topic: Intro to python programming - Final Score Calculation
question: How is the final course score T calculated for eligible students in Intro to python programming?
answer: The final course score T for eligible students in Intro to python programming is calculated as: T = 0.1 GAA1 (objective) + 0.1GAA2 (programming) + 0.1Qz1+ 0.4F+ 0.25 max(PE1, PE2) + 0.15 min(PE1, PE2) — capped to 100, where GAA1 is the average score in Best 10 objective assignments out of First 11, GAA2 is the average score in Best 10 programming assignments out of First 11, Qz1 is the score in Quiz I (0 if not attempted), PE1 is the score in OPPE1 (0 if not attempted), PE2 is the score in OPPE2 (0 if not attempted), and F is the score in the final exam.

answer: If you are present for both OPPE (score < 40/100) and ET (>=40) in System commands, your grade will be I_OP. You need to complete the BPT and OPE in the next term (BPTs will be eligibility for OPPE), with GA, quiz, and ET marks carried over, OR repeat the entire course.

topic: System commands - Grade Possibilities (Present OPPE, Absent ET)
question: If I am present for OPPE (score > 40/100) but absent for the ET in System commands, what are my options?
answer: If you are present for OPPE (score > 40/100) but absent for the ET in System commands, your grade will be I. You can complete ET alone in the next term; OPPE will NOT be given in this case. GA, quiz, and OPPE marks will be carried over, OR repeat the entire course.

question: What happens if I am present for both OPPE and ET and meet the passing criteria in System commands?
answer: If you are present for both OPPE and ET and meet the passing criteria in System commands, you will receive a grade as per the Total score T.

question: What are the quiz and end term dates and eligibility criteria for Application Development - 2?

question: What are the assessment types in Application Development - 2?
answer: The assessment types in Application Development - 2 include Weekly assessments (GAA1), Programming Assignments (GAA2), Quiz 1 (Qz1), Quiz 2 (Qz2), and End Sem (F). GAA1 is the average score in First 10 weekly objective assignments, and GAA2 is the average of weeks 1 and 2 programming assignments.

topic: Application Development - 2 - Final Course Score Calculation
question: How is the final course score T calculated for Application Development - 2?
answer: The final course score T for Application Development - 2 is calculated as: T = 0.05 GAA1 + 0.05 GAA2 + Max(0.35 * F + 0.25 * Qz1 + 0.3 * Qz2, 0.5 * F + 0.3 * Best(Qz1, Qz2)).

question: How many credits are the Project courses worth now?
answer: Project courses (BDM, MLP, App Dev 1, and App Dev 2) are now for 2 credits each.

question: Are Project courses part of CCC?
answer: No, the Project courses are not part of CCC. The CCC is only for theory courses.

question: What are the co-requisites for the Project courses?
answer: App Dev1 Theory is a co-requisite for App Dev 1 project. App Dev1 project is a corequisite for App Dev2 Theory. App Dev2 Theory is a corequisite for App Dev2 Project. MLP course is a co-requisite for MLP project. BDM course is a co-requisite for BDM project.

question: Are there any specific assessments in the MLP project course?
answer: Yes, there will be fortnightly assessments configured in the MLP project course alone that you have to submit. This information will be used to cross-check your engagement in the course.

question: How will projects be evaluated if both theory and project are completed in January 2025?
answer: If theory is completed in January 2025 and the project is completed in Jan 2025 (for MLP, MAD1, MAD2), the project will be evaluated on 105 marks until 30th March 2025.

topic: Project Evaluation (Theory Sep 2024 or Earlier, Project Jan 2025)
question: How will projects be evaluated if theory was completed in September 2024 or earlier and the project is completed in January 2025?
answer: If theory was completed in September 2024 or earlier and the project is completed in Jan 2025 (for Appdev and MLP), the project will be evaluated on 105 marks for submissions until 15th March 2025 for Appdev and until 12th March 2025 for MLP. For submissions beyond this, the project will be evaluated out of 100 marks.

question: How will the BDM project be evaluated?
answer: The BDM project will be evaluated only out of 100 marks for all students, irrespective of the term submitted in.

question: Where can I find information about the specific modalities and processes for each project?
answer: Each project has its own modalities and processes to be followed. Students should check their course announcements for the project timelines and make submissions accordingly.

answer: Guideline documents for the BDM project include: General instructions on preparing a report (link provided), Capstone Project Rubrics for Analysis with Primary Data (link provided), and Capstone Project Rubrics for Analysis with Secondary Data (link provided).

answer: The guideline document for the MLP project is available at the provided link.

question: For how long is the fee paid for each project valid?
answer: The fee paid for each of the 4 projects is valid for 2 terms.

question: What is the project fee for new registration, and is there a category waiver?
answer: The project fee for new registration is 2500, and there is a category waiver. The grade received will be the actual grade.

topic: Project Fee - Not Completed in Registered Term
question: What happens if the project is not completed in the registered term?
answer: If the project is not completed in the registered term, the fee is retained for the subsequent term, and the grade will be marked as I (Incomplete). If not completed in the second term also, the registration becomes invalid, the student has to pay the full fees again, and a U grade will be given.

question: What happens if a student fails in the project?
answer: If a student fails in the project, they have to redo the project by registering again and paying the full fees. A U grade will be given. If the submission is also found to be Plagiarized, the student will be subjected to disciplinary action.

question: What are the project timelines for students entering Degree level in Jan 2025?
answer: For students doing projects in the January 2025 term who will be entering Degree level in the Jan 2025 term, they must complete all 12 courses and 4 projects to start degree level courses from Jan 2025 onwards.

question: What are the project timelines for students entering Degree level in May 2025?
answer: For entering the Degree level in May 2025, students have to complete ALL projects and vivas by March 2025. The BDM project final submission has to be done and approved by Feb/March 2025 so that viva can be over in March/April 2025. Project grades for all the courses will be pushed on/before April 20th.

question: Where can I find information about Viva policies and planners for the Jan 2025 term?
answer: Information about Viva policies and planners for the Jan 2025 term for MLP and Appdev will be available at the links provided.

question: What is the criteria for getting Diploma certificates for students who completed courses and projects in Sep 2021/Jan 2022 terms?
answer: Students who completed 6 courses and 2 projects of any of the two Diplomas will get the Diploma certificates. However, their credits for the Diploma will be 23 or 25 instead of 27, depending on how many courses were completed in those two terms. Projects done as part of the courses will not get the 2 credits. This deficit will need to be made up by taking more elective courses at the BSc level.

question: What do the digits in the Degree level course codes represent?
answer: The first digit of the 4 digits given in the course code represents the level of the course. For example, CS1001 is a level 1 course, CS3004 is a level 3 course, and MS4001 is a level 4 course.

question: What are the mandatory requirements at the BSc level?
answer: At the BSc level, it is now mandatory to complete both the core pairs and SPG, totaling 20 credits. All 8 credits can be earned from IITM BS courses, NPTEL (maximum 4 credits from Table 2), or campus courses. This is effective from Sep 2023 for the batch entering degree level then. Additionally, 2 courses in level 4 or higher must be completed in each of the BP and BD categories, and 4 credits in the HS/MG category are mandatory.

question: How can I earn the remaining credits at the BSc level?
answer: The remaining credits at the BSc level can be earned from any of the other in-house/campus electives or Apprenticeship electives.

question: Is Apprenticeship mandatory at the BSc level?
answer: No, Apprenticeship is completely optional. Students can also complete the BS level by just doing only coursework.

question: Are there any recommendations for taking additional courses and learning more skills?
answer: Yes, the document recommends learning more on programming and data science outside of the curriculum to strengthen your resume and provides links to NPTEL courses for C++, Haskell, Competitive programming, Cloud computing, Blockchain, and Compiler Design. It also mentions SWAYAM NPTEL Approved Dep/Free Elective and HS/MG course lists and collaborations with Microsoft and AWS certification programs.
